          performance.mark('gtm.start');
          (function (w, d, s, l, i) {
            w[l] = w[l] || [];
            w[l].push({ 'gtm.start': new Date().getTime(), event: 'gtm.js' });
            var f = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
                j = d.createElement(s),
                dl = l != 'dataLayer' ? '&l=' + l : '';
            j.async = true;
            j.src = 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=' + i + dl;
            j.onload = function () {
              performance.mark('gtm.end');
              performance.measure('gtm', 'gtm.start', 'gtm.end');
            };
            f.parentNode.insertBefore(j, f);
        })(window, document, 'script', 'dataLayer', 'GTM-M36RG8PT');

class="stats Stats_root__p_BoZ"><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">6 likes</span><span -->views</span><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_tag__Xx37c" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rl29r6:" id=":Rl29r6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl29r6"></div></div><div class="author Author_root___6Bx5"><a data-cy="author-link" class="Author_link___lVxw ellipsis" title="CrowdStrike" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike"><div class="Avatar_root__GNWHY" style="width:24px;height:24px;line-height:24px"><img decoding="sync"/></div><span>CrowdStrike</span></a></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document discusses adversary problems in cybersecurity, focusing on the identification and categorization of various adversary groups and their activities. It highlights notable adversaries, their motivations, and the tactics they utilize, such as spearphishing and lateral movement, while emphasizing the need for intelligence-driven security. The presentation also includes insights from CrowdStrike experts and encourages organizations to implement adversary-focused security practices.</p><div class="pills-list PillsList_root__2EydN"><a class="Pill_root__IqOYH" aria-label="View the featured presentations, documents and infographics in the Technology Category" href="https://www.slideshare.net/category/technology"><span class="icon 4

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-4-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide5" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-4" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

Adversary Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-12-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-12-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-12-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-12-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide13" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-12" alt="Intelligence: STONE PANDA
OPERATIONAL
WINDOW

May 2010 to Present

@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

TARGETING
Healthcare
Defense
Aerospace

OBJECTIVES

Recon
Lateral movement
Data exfiltration

Government

TOOLS

Poison Ivy RAT

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-28-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-28-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-28-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-28-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide29" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-28" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Target Sectors: Media

WHO IS
SILENT
CHOLLIMA?

Concealment Troy; LSG

www.sdmp.kr; www.socrates.tw;

29

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-29-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide30" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-29" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Adversary-Centric

1

INTELLIGENCE

Understand the adversaries targeting your
Vertical | Company | Geo-Location | Customers

2

Build appropriate defenses to counter/detect
these adversaries

3

Perform other security practices from an
Adversary-centric perspective
Pen Testing (Red Team)
Security Operations Brieﬁngs
Log Review

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

30

 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/75/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/crowdcastsmonthlyyouhaveanadversaryproblem-131016140939-phpapp01/85/CrowdCasts-Monthly-You-Have-an-Adversary-Problem-30-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide31" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:959 / 540" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-30" alt="@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Making it Actionable

1
ACTIONALIZING INTELLIGENCE

Intelligence is diﬃcult to consume
Lots of information to keep straight
New data constantly ﬂowing in (possibly unvetted)

2

Security Operations need to change shis &amp; people

3

Actionable Intelligence

Pass down can’t possibly occur with all indicators

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

class="sr-only"></span></span></span>CrowdCasts Monthly: You Have an Adversary Problem</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" ADVERSARY </a> PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#2">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

AGENDA

YOU </a> HAVE AN ADVERSARY PROBLEM.

 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#3">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
ADAM MEYERS |
VP, INTELLIGENCE
Recognized speaker, trainer, and intelligence expert with 15+ years
of cyber security industry experience
10 years in the DIB supporting US GOV customers on topics
ranging from wireless, pen testing, IR, and malware analysis

@ADAM_CYBER

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

3

 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#4">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
MATT DAHL |
SENIOR ANALYST/ LEGAL COUNSEL
Cyber threat analyst focused on targeted intrusion activity
Focused on investigating indicators of compromise to identify
specific adversary activity
Legal liaison to the CrowdStrike Intelligence Team

@CROWDSTRIKE

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

4

 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#5">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries </a> are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

5

 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#6">INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

Adversary </a> Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

colludes with Anonymous
group XL3gi0n

members added

formation of TCA

compromise of US financial

participation in
#opblacksummer

announces new personal page

arrested by Tunisian
Authorities

vulnerability on
Sourceforge

WHO IS
CORSAIR
JACKAL?

Primarily One Individual: Fahmi Ben
Khlifa (XTnR3v0LT)

malicious activity, but also white hat
activity.
Cross-site scripting attacks used to
compromise databases at target
organizations.

It involves forming hypotheses about potential attacks based on indicators and then validating those hypotheses by searching for related evidence. While threat hunting requires time, skills, and resources that many organizations lack, Panda Security's Threat Hunting and Investigation Service (THIS) provides threat hunting as a managed service at no extra cost with their Adaptive Defense 360 platform. CTI can include tactical, operational, and strategic intelligence about security events, indicators of compromise, malware behavior, threat actors, and mapping online threats to geopolitical events over short, medium, and long timeframes. Hackers use social engineering because it is less resistant than other attacks and more successful. Common goals are money, ego, revenge, or knowledge. Typical attacks involve posing as customer service, deliveries, tech support, etc. Social engineering methods include dumpster diving, shoulder surfing, baiting, vishing, phishing, and whaling. Dumpster diving involves searching trash for useful information. Shoulder surfing means watching people enter passwords. Baiting uses enticing offers to infect systems with malware. Phishing fools people via email into revealing sensitive info or installing malware. It provides background on the crash dump stack and how it differs from the normal I/O path. It then describes how identifying and calling the crash dump port and miniport drivers allows sending I/O requests outside of the normal path to bypass bootkit filters and read/write directly to disk. The document concludes with an overview of how this technique can be demonstrated against the TDL4 bootkit.","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/io-you-own-regaining-control-of-your-disk-in-the-presence-of-bootkits/15921485","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":5385}],"featured":null,"latest":[{"algorithmId":"4","displayTitle":"Top Managed Service Providers in Los Angeles","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":13,"score":0,"slideshowId":"281657480","sourceName":"LATEST","strippedTitle":"top-managed-service-providers-in-los-angeles","extension":"pptx","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/topmanagedserviceprovidersinlosangeles-250716055432-afd8bf87-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"This highlights the leading MSPs in Los Angeles, offering businesses reliable IT support, cybersecurity, and cloud services. xAI pushed Grok 4 behind a $300/mo\npaywall.\n• Agentic computing became a dominant theme—AWS pre-announced an “Agent Marketplace,” OpenAI and Perplexity teased AI-native browsers,\nSalesforce unveiled the GTA1 GUI agent, and MIRIX/H-NET showed multi-agent memory \u0026 planning breakthroughs.\n• Long-context and efficient inference advances flourished: SmolLM3 (128 K), Microsoft Phi-4 Mini Flash, PERK adapters, MoR recursion, and CoLa\ntest-time depth skipping.\n• Hardware race intensified: NVIDIA updated NCCL \u0026 Riva, AMD MI300 kernel work landed at HF, Groq hunted a $6 B valuation, and TSMC posted\nrecord AI-chip revenue.\n• Multimodality \u0026 3D surged: NVIDIA DiffusionRenderer created editable 3-D scenes from one video; Google’s Gemini Embedding 001 and Griffin\ngraph model broadened domain reach.\n• Safety, evaluation \u0026 governance stayed in focus: Bullshit Index, REST multi-question stress test, “One-token” judge attacks, RabakBench for lowresource\nsafety, and new DoD/Anthropic \u0026 Pentagon programs.\n• Capital continued to flood in—Mistral courting $1 B, xAI eyeing $200 B valuation, Amazon pondering another multibillion bet on Anthropic, SpaceX to\ninject $2 B into xAI.\n• Regulatory and geopolitical undercurrents: Malaysia’s AI-chip re-export permits, OpenAI tightening IP security, SB 1047 revival in California,\ndeepfake and voice-spoof incidents raising alarm.","tags":["ai","newmind ai","weekly chronicles"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/newmind-ai-journal-weekly-chronicles-july-25-week-ii/281634695","userLogin":"evrennewmind","userName":"NewMind AI","viewCount":313}]},"slideDimensions":{"height":540,"width":959},"sectionSummaries":[{"summaryList":"[\n    {\n        \"slides\": [\n            1,\n            2\n        ],\n        \"topic\": \"Understanding Adversary Problems\",\n        \"cover\": \"Introduction to adversary problems in cybersecurity.
